headline: Homemade Hot Apple Cider
description: Nothing beats this apple cider recipe. Enjoy a hot mug of fresh apple cider sweetened with pure maple syrup for a perfect treat on a cold winter day.

video.description: SEP 0002 Hot Apple Cider - APPROVED -- Vanessa
video.name: Hot Apple Cider

name: Homemade Hot Apple Cider

recipeInstructions.text: Pour apple cider and maple syrup into a large stainless steel saucepan.

Place cinnamon sticks, cloves, allspice berries, orange peel, and lemon peel in the center of a square of washed cheesecloth; fold up the sides of the cheesecloth to enclose the bundle, then tie it up with a length of kitchen string. Drop the spice bundle into the cider mixture.
Place the saucepan over moderate heat for 5 to 10 minutes, or until cider is very hot but not boiling.
Remove cider from the heat. Discard the spice bundle. Ladle cider into big cups or mugs, adding a fresh cinnamon stick to each serving if desired.

review.reviewBody: This is perfect for parties - make it on the stovetop then put it in the crock pot and forget about it. Guests can serve themselves with a ladle. I added the thinly sliced apples (great!) and did not use the cheesecloth, instead just dropped everything in. Used ground allspice instead of berries. For Christmas I used glass coffee mugs and added spiced rum to the batch (two shots per person - strong but good!) and more maple syrup. Guests still rave about it. THANK YOU for this recipe.
Despite a myriad of religions and tastes, everyone loved it! ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Great Recipe, Awesome Results, Nice to tweak year after year (year 6 now!) People love it!
Really good, really easy! I didn't think it would only take 10-15 minutes. My mom always made hot apple cider during the fall and winter when I was a kid. It makes the house smell so good too.

Did not have allspice berries so I used star anise with the ground allspice. It worked. I also didn't have cheesecloth so i used a pot with a strainer. This was delicious. I made it in a crock pot, tripled the recipe and served it piping hot. Some of my guests added Weldon Mills Distillery caramel apple bourbon which was also very delicious.

I wanted to celebrate the changing of the seasons with hot apple cider, and I was so happy with this recipe that I made a second batch. I had to use ground allspice instead but all the same it was perfect.
Excellent. Kids and adults loved the flavor.

When i tried making it, this turned out...... AMAZING!!! I gave this a five star because, when i had drunk the apple cider. MWAH...DELICOUS!! Thank You, for sharing this recipe. This was very relaxing when I also drunk this on the couch, rading a book. AMAZING! JUST AMAZING!!! I love this recipe!
I make this every Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas! My family loves it so much!
This recipe received Rave Reviews from my Family! I used unfiltered cider made with honey crisp apples and the flavor was outstanding. Will hold onto this one for another chilly night.
I got rave reviews on this! I already had all the ground spices in my cabinet so I used those. It was a hit!

Delicious recipe. made it as written, except I added 1/4 tsp of Allspice as I couldn't find the berries and had no cheesecloth so just threw everything in and then strained it. Thank you for an amazing recipe.
So so good. Can’t find the berries so I just add more cloves. Also put a little orange slice in the cup along with a shot of pecan vodka!!!!!
We will be making this a lot. Wow. I made as written and it is exactly what I wanted it to be.
We will be making this a lot. Wow. I made as written and it is exactly what I wanted it to be.
I substituted a scant of brown sugar for the syrup, it was delicious !
Wow! This was great.
I served it on Thanksgiving - it was a big hit. I sliced the orange and lemon thin then 'floated' them in the cider. When I took them out people ate them all - they said they were like eating candy.
This was great with rum ! I only put a touch of maple syrop though, as it was sweet enough.

Very good cider recipe. I brought it to a fall bake sale for work and people absolutely loved it. I did not have cheese cloth, so I let the different items float freely for about two hours before removing them. Super simple to make and I absolutely recommend this!
I had no cheesecloth on this cold rainy day so I popped all the spices in a teaball and tossed it in. Super good recipe.
Delicious! My family loves this on a cold winter day! Yummy.
This turned out amazing! Will be making again this holiday season.
Entire family like this and so easy to make,

I will definitely make this again...tonight! I absolutely loved this recipe. Others thought it was too sweet, but I thought it was less sweet than other recipes. I like using maple syrup instead of sugar, and I used real maple syrup. The only modification I made was using whole orange and lemon slices instead of just the peel, as others have recommended. I made it last night for a family gathering and it was such a hit that I’m making it again tonight for my friends.

I've served this the last 2 years for Thanksgiving and Christmas parties. Everyone loves it! I make a large batch in a crock pot. After I remove the bag I leave 2 or 3 cinnamon sticks while keeping it warm.
I had to add some water because it was a too sweet. My guests loved it.
I will definitely be making this again! I just used ground spices that I had in the cupboard except for the cinnamon sticks. LOVED this!

So I didn't read the part about the cheese cloth bags until after I already got home from the grocery store. But doesn't matter it turned out delicious!!! If it's too sweet for some have some hot water near by to cut the sweetness. And to make this a tasty adult beverage for an even better drink add some fireball cinnamon whisky!!??
We always get lots of compliments on this recipe!
I made it with some juice and added whipped cream on top. Great!

I make this for every Christmas celebration and serve it warmed, in a crock pot. Instead of using orange peel, I just use one small Clementine orange, stick the 6 whole cloves in its surface, and float it in the pot. As for the lemon, one 4 or 5" swirl of peel is plenty and it adds a festive look to the concoction. Other than that, I make it exactly as written and it's been a "hit" every time.
I added a star anise pod, 5 cloves, 3 cinnamon sticks, 8 orange rind strips, and eliminated the sugar and the lemon, and it is delicious!

Everyone loved it at our Thanksgiving dinner. I used organic apple juice instead of apple cider. My lemon seemed to mysteriously disappear from the fridge so this was left out but did not detract from the outcome in any way. Optional, add some Cointreau for an adult apple cider. Enjoy!
Great recipe-guests loved it! I sliced an orange and a lemon instead of just the rind and it made for great presentation.
Really amazing! Just remember to remove the spice bundle and discard if you're going to let the cider sit on the stovetop! Also good spiked - butterscotch schnapps, apple flavored vodka, etc.
Delicious! And easy to make.
Just absolutely love this recipe. The lemon and orange peels make the flavor just Pop... This is old fashioned apple cider at its best.
This recipe is simply delicious! I made for a party and everyone loved it, and even had some ask for the recipe the next day. I followed exactly what recipe said.
Took this to a pot luck and people went crazy. I used a gallon of cider and adjusted the recipe accordingly. My only change was less citrus. I used 1/2 of the peels suggested in this recipe.

There are no adjustments necessary. This is ALWAYS a hit made exactly as the author wrote the recipe. It is an Autumn staple in our house. Sometimes I make it in the crockpot so my family and friends can drink it all day - it is EXTREMELY important to take the peels out as soon as it is seasoned to your taste or the cider will become too bitter. By far the best apple cider I have ever had!

We really enjoy hot holiday beverages. This is great for the kids and also adults when feel like something other than mulled wine. (When is that again?). LOL. Good for your Designated Drivers at holiday parties, too!
Here are some tips:
If leaving it to sit, remove spices so it doesn't get too strong. I put allspice berries and cloves in a tea ball! Don't leave orange/lemon peels in too long or it will become bitter. Add a splash of lemon juice if no lemons available. Would be pretty served with orange & lemon peels and cranberries floating in it.

For a very special treat, we use caramel syrup (like sundae topping) drizzled in a clear ("fancy") glass mug and topped with whipped cream. This will make the kids (and honestly, most adults too) go crazy. Better than a Caramel Apple Cider drink you'll pay $5 for at a coffee shop!

I have made this cider twice and it was a big hit both times at my parties. I didn't bother with a bag and just let the spices and peels float around in the pot. Had to leave out the allspice and I used 1 tsp ground cinammon instead of a stick and 1/4 cup of brown sugar instead of maple syrup. The ground cinammon clumps at first, but disolves as the cider gets hot. When I cut the peels,I made sure to use as little of the white part as possible to avoid bitterness. Some of the peels were almost translucent they were so thin. Mixed with red wine, this cider makes an excellent vin brulè as well. Enjoy!

It smells really good...but tastes EVEN BETTER. i used ground cinnamon and ground all spice. I also squeezed some lemon juice in there... Next time i think ill use just a tad less maple syrup...but overall this is great.
This is SO GOOD!
took a little while to get all the flavours infused so need to put this on to cook before you cook anything else. Adding spiced rum doesnt hurt either
Perfect!
Not sweet enough. Lemon peel made cider too sour.

Fresh, not overly sweet, and fabulous. I don't have allspice berries, so I put ground allspice in a tea sac with the citrus rinds and cinnamon, etc. A new favorite. I make it once a week now. This will be a tradition for my young family every fall. Bring on the hot apple cider! Mmm. I just may go make it now.

This was good and I really liked the idea of it but it wasn't perfect for me. My husband really enjoyed it and that's why I'm giving it 4 stars. I followed the recipe exactly except that I could not find whole allspice and had to substitute ground. I think I ended up using 1/2 teaspoon. This smelled wonderful while it was cooking, but the end result was a little too tart for me. I would probably make this again but make an effort to add some more sweetness.
The boyfriend is sick and I wanted to give him something other than hot tea. Followed directions to a tittle and we both liked it very much. Thank you! Will be making this again.
So yummy and easily modified.

I love this apple cider recipe. I tried it at home first and really liked it. So then I placed it in my crockpot and took it to work and various potlucks. When using my crockpot, I increase the juice to 64 oz instead of 48 oz and double the cloves and allspice along. I place my crockpot on high for 30-40 minutes and then let it simmer until it smells delicious. Some events I take an extra bottle of apple cider and add after it is half gone then turn crockpot setting to high for 15-20 minutes and back to simmer. If I am going to a big potluck I will quadruple this recipe. Happy Cooking & Baking!
Love this for the fall.
Very easy & yummy!
Perfect apple cider! Everyone loved it. We had a little left over and it was great warmed up a few days later.

I'd give this 10 stars if I could. This is THE most delicious hot apple cider EVER. I followed the recipe exactly, made a vat of it for a Christmas party, and everyone wanted the recipe! The kids loved it, and some of us adults tried it with a dash of cinnamon liqueur, and was THAT ever delish! I highly recommend this great recipe.
wow! this is great. full of flavour and my family couldn't stop talking about it. I would never have put in maple syrup or orange and lemon peels, but it made this tase=te amazing. so good.

Made this for Christmas Eve and it was a hit! I found the allspice berries at Wal-mart, no problem. The cheesecloth I had didn't wrap well around the peels so I just put those in the cider. Wonderful recipe. I have an extra gallon left over so I plan on making this for New Year's as well!

I served 2 gallons to a high school group. I used the ingredients calculated for 32 servings except put in half an orange and half a lemon instead of peels. Cider was heating (not quite simmering) for about an hour. 2nd and 3rd helping were requested...not a drop left!
This is fabulous. Family thought it was the best cider they've tasted.
I had never made cider and used this recipe. Everyone at the party asked for the recipe. Making again this weekend.

Tasty cider. Made for Thanksgiving and brewed all afternoon in a crock pot. Made recipe as is except didn't add maple syrup. The cider was sweet enough as is. House smelled wonderful and kids loved it.

Tasty cider. Made for Thanksgiving and brewed all afternoon in a crock pot. Made recipe as is except didn't add maple syrup. The cider was sweet enough as is. House smelled wonderful and kids loved it.

Hi,
I actually have a question: When speaking about 'cider' is it fresh apple juice or an alcoholic beverage? Thanks!
I used cinnamon and nutmeg instead of cinnamon sticks. Also added brown sugar instead of maple syrup. Then sliced and added the entire orange and lemon, not only peel. It was delicious!

I made 23 servings of this hot apple cider recipe for the very first time today and my bunco friends loved it! On this cold autumn evening in the Ozarks, this cider was perfect! I had to use allspice powder instead of the allspice berries. I highly recommend this recipe!
delicious, my boyfriend is obsessed with apple cider and says its the best he's ever had. didn't use allspice berries but i was still great!
doesn't need the maple syrup and i left out the allspice. yummmy

I make this exact same thing every holiday season for our friends and families when entertaining. I Also add the fresh apple peices when serving. I make it in larger batches in a large coffee percolator with a filter in the basket.When done we all drink it right up! I came back to find the recipe to share with someone who does not have access to this site. So VERY TASTY Stella Thanks.
Made for Christmas last year. Brewed in a crockpot all afternoon. It was sweet, spicy and delicious! If it were thickened slightly, it would make an excellent pancake syrup.

I made this back in the fall and it was delicious! I dont like really sweet beverages and I thought this was perfect. I may have added just a hint less syrup than the recipe called for- but I cant remember. Just follow the recipe as is.
This is so tasty! It's our new holiday drink.

I LOVE this cider. I make twice as much for my annual christmas party and it's always gone so quickly! I put the spices in coffee filter paper but didn't have anything to tie it so it all came apart and floated around... But that's okay! I fished them out after about 30-45 minutes with a strainer... the taste is still the same :) I love the cider with cookies... sweet cookies and slightly bitter cider=amazing.
Very good, I would prefer to just use brown sugar in place of the syrup next time
What a great combination! Maple Syrup and Apple Cider! Two of my most favorite Vermont products all in one place! (my cup!) We will be enjoying this every Thanksgiving / Autumn Season.
AWESOME!! Once done I put it in the crock pot and added some Cinnamon Apple Spice Hebal Tea (Celestial Seasonings). Soo good!!
This cider was AMAZING. (Especially good when you add rum!)
This recipe is excellent. I triple the spices to give it a little more kick. Very tasty!
So good...I put mine in the crockpot and let it get warm...Will be making again. Thanks!
This was a hit at my Christmas party. I didn't have cheesecloth, so I just put everything in. It made it look more festive. Easy to make and yummy to drink!
This recipe is a perfect example of "greater than a sum of its parts".All the flavors meld together seamlessly. Made it as is and everyone went wild for it- kids and adults.
Everyone who had this loved it.
We served this at Thanksgiving today, and it was a huge hit! Everyone loved it. I will absolutely make this again.
I didn't use all the syrup called for, and I didn't have any lemons on hand. Other than that, I followed this recipe exactly and it came out *awesome*.

Tasty and easy! I used 1/4 tsp each ground allspice and cloves and 1.2 tsp cinnamon and I used a full 2 quarts of apple cider. Floated the fruit in it in a crockpot for about an hour. Then I removed all but one orange and one lemon slice for decoration.
I thought the maple syrup made it too sweet. Next time I will make it without the syrup or with much less syrup. But this recipe was very good.

This was really good. Instead of just adding the peels, I added slices of orange and lemon because it looks pretty. Next time I won't leave them in as long. As a previous poster mentioned, the citrus tends to make the cider bitter after a while. It's important to add the spices that are mentioned. If you use ground spices as a substitute, it won't dissolve quite right and you'll have a layer of spices on the top.

AWESOME!!! I hate when people review and use so many changes but I do 't have time to re-write a recipe, so here is what I did. 12 cups Apple cider 1/2 cup maple syrup 4 TBSP CARAMEL 10 cloves 4 or 5 shakes of Pumpkin Pie Spice 1 orange peel 4 cinnamon sticks. It was a hit!
This is an absolutely great recipe! I've been asked to make this for Halloween, Thanksgiving and Christmas. I followed the recipe as it is.
The very best!
Had a very strong lemon flavor which made the cider bitter. I may try again withought he lemon.
Simply wonderful! tossed everything in slow cooker and didn't use cheese cloth. very yummy

This is the best ever spiced apple cider I have had. Nothing was overpowering. For a double batch, I cut the maple syrup to a scant tablespoon, just used the 2 cinnamon sticks, and used ground instead of whole cloves. A coffee filter works great for the bag. I simmered for 1 hour but removed the orange and lemon peel at 20 minutes. I threw away my other recipes for this drink. It's that good.

SO good! I wasn't a fan of home-made hot apple cider until I made this for a family get together last fall. My family cans their own apple juice in the fall, and that is what I used for the apple cider. Enjoyed by all... thanks for sharing!

I loved this! Thank you! I used a teaspoon of ground cinnamon because I did have fresh on hand. I didn't have lemon, either, so I tipped just a little bit of lemon juice in there. This is great. Thank you!

pretty good. I had to make some modifications though. Instead of maple syrup, we used some brown sugar. I had to double the amount of spices...we like ours SPICED!!! Added fruit as well as the rind...why not? Make in the crock pot so it stayed warm. Make sure not to leave the orange and lemon in too long...they can take over. OK....so I made a lot of changes. I give four stars for the original recipe....nearly 5 for mine!

Very good, I did change it a bit. I added more allspice, cloves and cinnimon. Added some motts single serving cinnimon apple sauce for that apple texture, also added some caramel syrup about 2 tbsp. I left the orange and lemon peel in about 20 min or it will get a little bitter.

I made this for a Christmas Eve party and my family loved it - three people asked for the recipe! I will be making this again for New years Eve (it's great with a little bit of spiced rum too ). Thank you for the recipe!
